title.narrative: Medilink phase VI - Traning of palestinian doctors in Israel

description.narrative:
Development objectives:
To upgrade the medical services provided to the Palestinian public by strengthening the Palestinian hospitals. This will be achieved by training medical personnel at all levels, specialists, sub-specialists, nurses, technicians and lab workers, working as teams to provide state of the art medicine, Thus significantly contributing to the Palestinian healthcare system to treat patients with complicated illnesses.
The creation of a network of professionals in the medical field working in cooperation to the benefit of the people of the region.
The Palestinian - Israeli civil society relations established and strengthened by establishing mutual trust and understanding.
Immediate objectives:
Palestinian doctors and other health workers educated and trained in areas where the Palestinian health sector is lacking in competences.
Professional dialogue, networking and personal relations established between the Palestinian trainees and their Israeli counterparts.
Appreciation of program achievements enhanced in the Palestinian and Israeli societies.
